artist: Artist: Attributed to Giovanni Battista Ricci da Novara; Artist: Attributed to Cesare Nebbia; Artist: Formerly attributed to Agostino Ciampellli
description: mounted to sheet with gold, green and black borders; figure standing on platform with columns behind him; figures wears draping garment; standing figures at right and center in middle ground; other figures' torsos visible in lower corners; architectural elements in background center and upper right
markings: ULC, stamped in black: [(crown) / C G (intertwined)] Lugt 545
medium: Pen and dark brown ink and wash on laid paper
provenance: Commendatore Modesto Ignazio Bonaventura Luigi Genovesio Lugt 545 (five-pearl variant crown; Lugt misidentified as Conte Gelozzi or Gelosi) Turin (until 1794; sold, March 8, to Turinetti); Marchese Giovanni Antonio Turinetti di Priero, Turin (1794-at least 1801). [Yvonne Tan Bunzl, London, until 1984; sold, September 20, for Â£500, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1984-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Saint Paul Preaching in Athens
